intro: Echinocarpus woollsii, commonly known as the Woolly Sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ribbed stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a dry, spiny capsule that contains several seeds. Echinocarpus woollsii is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, growing in sandy or rocky soils.
